text.p: - Switzerland considers the so-called Washington Agreement of 1946 still valid. The agreement regulated distribution of Nazi gold after World War II. A spokesman from foreign ministry said Switzerland did not see any need for action following U.S. senator Alfonse D'Amato's proposal to renegotiate the issue.
- Hansueli Loosli has been appointed new chief executive of Coop, the second largest supermarket chain in Switzerland.

- The International Monetary (IMF) Found predicted in its latest World Economic Outlook a 2.5 percent growth in the gross domestic products in western countries in 1997. For Switzerland however, IMF forecast a 1.5 percent increase in GDP in 1997.
- Zurich Insurance group offered 105 million Swiss francs to take over Norwegian insurance group Protector Forsikring ASA.
- Restructuring measures of Swiss textile machine manufacturer Saurer have so far been successful and the company recently raised its expectations for 1996.
